channel.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
channel.description:
Hey guys, just wondering your opinions on the new Harry Potter movie coming out (Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows).
I'm a big fan of these movies, I own a copy of all the DVDS. You can watch the trailer [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_EC2tmFVNNE] here. [/url] (Watch it in HD for better quality).
Part I hits theaters on November 19th, 2010.
Its also coming out in 3D in selected cinemas.
Note: Watch the trailer before you post.

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“humidifier, post:45, topic:354839”]I was very very sad to find out that she just ended it like that. weather it was to leave it up to the reader so that it makes it more…i dont know what…, or she just got bored of writing it, i would have really enjoyed a proper ending. something that you can say “And they lived happily ever after” to, not something yo uhave to wonder about…[/quote]100% agree. My main wonderings are the Weasleys, and what happened to Hogwarts.

Read full topic
item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @humidifier humidifier
item.description:
@humidifier wrote:

I was very very sad to find out that she just ended it like that. weather it was to leave it up to the reader so that it makes it more…i dont know what…, or she just got bored of writing it, i would have really enjoyed a proper ending. something that you can say “And they lived happily ever after” to, not something yo uhave to wonder about…

Read full topic
item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @Priv_Serv_Man Priv Serv Man
item.description:
@Priv_Serv_Man wrote:

Yeah maybe she did…7 books with hundreds of pages would get old after a while, but I stayed interested til the last one, it took me forever to read cuz I just wasn’t that into the series anymore.

Read full topic
item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:42, topic:354839”][quote author=Priv Serv Man link=topic=451408.msg3318440#msg3318440 date=1282503920]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=451408.msg3317371#msg3317371 date=1282418006]

is there still a movie to come out?
the last one?
I know that the only book i havent read it the last one, so i bet thats the one
[/quote]Yea, the last one.
Personally I think JK ended it too quickly, I mean we know nothing about what happened to anyone after the war, except the marriages. What is Harrys’ profession? Is he a Quidditch player or an Aurour? What happened to the rest of the Weasleys?

It would have been cool to find out what happened to everyone, but I think she kind of left it to the reader to decide.
[/quote]I think she just wanted to finish writing.[/quote]
Most likely.
Although, had she written another one, I don’t think I could’ve come to reading it. I got bored with the series after 5, but being I had read them up to that point, had to finish.

Read full topic
item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

yes, i readeach book in 2-3 days…
firstly because i dont have that much time every day, and secondly, if i read half a book in one day, i just quit, and continue the next day…
[/quote]

Woah, it takes me like a month or two to read a book :|[/quote]Why… What’s your reading level?

I’m looking forward to it personally. I enjoyed the books, too.
[/quote]
I thought all of the books were great.
I actually just reread the last book last night.
There such an easy read…[/quote]I like to take at least a day or two to read each book, I feel like I capture more of it.

I read a lot, and harry potter was just perfect for me.

item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @Priv_Serv_Man Priv Serv Man
item.description:
@Priv_Serv_Man wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:28, topic:354839”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=451408.msg3314220#msg3314220 date=1282182168]

My favorite book is probably the fifth, my favorite movie is probably also the fifth.

5th was order of phoniex?

Yes. I actually haven’t cared much for the movies, but I’m a die-hard reader, so movies are just bleh when based off of a book.
Example: Eragon. Good book and series, dead awful movie.
[/quote]I know… the movie almost ruined the series…[/quote]

Ah yes the Eragon book series was epic but the movie was absolutely terrible…

[quote=“humidifier, post:29, topic:354839”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=451408.msg3310527#msg3310527 date=1281943103]
I found book 7 to be completely forced it was evident that the author had no interest in writing it. The movie is going to really have to develop more of its own content if it wants to make two movies from the pile of rubbish Rowling provided them.
[/quote]

probably just wanted 2 or 3 books to get money, but since they were a hit, she was kinda forced to write more[/quote]

I wouldn’t agree with this really…she was pretty dedicated about writing those books, except maybe the 7th, but I still enjoyed it and I think the movie will be alright in 2 parts.

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
item.dc:creator: @im_hard im hard
item.description:
@im_hard wrote:

[quote=“Priv Serv Man, post:23, topic:354839”][quote author=im hard link=topic=451408.msg3312590#msg3312590 date=1282079729]

Was the 6th book ever made into a movie? Or did I miss it completly??
[/quote]Yes it was. It was an OK movie.

I don’t even know if I would say it was an OK movie, it messed a lot of things up.

That was the half blood prince right? I didn’t really like that one.

I didn’t think it was too bad, but of course the books are better…
I’ve read all the books twice and own all the dvds the new movie looks pretty cool, and like createdhorror said it’ll follow the story better with 2 parts. 3D fails -.-[/quote]

Yeah, I mean it wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t really good either. It was just normal… My favorite is Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone (the first one). Usually the first ones are always the best.

Read full topic
